@@ -8,19 +8,26 @@ WORKDIR /app
COPY package*.json ./

# Install all dependencies (needed for build)
RUN npm install
RUN npm ci

# Copy source code
COPY . .

# Build the application
RUN npm run build

# Remove dev dependencies
RUN npm prune --production
# Install only production dependencies and remove dev dependencies
RUN npm ci --only=production && npm cache clean --force

# Create a non-root user
RUN addgroup -g 1001 -S nodejs && adduser -S nodeuser -u 1001

# Change ownership of the app directory to the nodeuser
RUN chown -R nodeuser:nodejs /app
USER nodeuser

# Expose port
EXPOSE 8080

# Start the server
CMD ["node", "server.js"]
CMD ["node", "proxy-server.cjs"]

@@ -129,29 +129,57 @@ build_app() {
    echo_success "Build completed successfully"
}

# Function to deploy to GCP
# Function to deploy to GCP Cloud Run
deploy_to_gcp() {
    echo_info "Deploying to Google Cloud Platform..."
    echo_info "Deploying to Google Cloud Run..."

    # Set the correct GCP project
    gcloud config set project $PROJECT_ID

    # Enable required APIs
    echo_info "Enabling Cloud Run API..."
    gcloud services enable run.googleapis.com

    # Build container image first (faster and more reliable)
    case $ENVIRONMENT in
        dev)
            echo_info "Deploying to development environment..."
            gcloud app deploy --version=dev --no-promote --quiet
            SERVICE_NAME="ai-universe-frontend-dev"
            ENV_VARS="NODE_ENV=development,VITE_MCP_SERVER_URL=/api/mcp,VITE_APP_NAME=AI Universe Dev,VITE_DEBUG_MODE=true"
            TRAFFIC_FLAG="--no-traffic"
            ;;
        staging)
            echo_info "Deploying to staging environment..."
            gcloud app deploy --version=staging --no-promote --quiet
            SERVICE_NAME="ai-universe-frontend-staging"
            ENV_VARS="NODE_ENV=staging,VITE_MCP_SERVER_URL=/api/mcp,VITE_APP_NAME=AI Universe Staging,VITE_DEBUG_MODE=false"
            TRAFFIC_FLAG="--no-traffic"
            ;;
        prod)
            echo_info "Deploying to production environment..."
            gcloud app deploy --quiet
            SERVICE_NAME="ai-universe-frontend"
            ENV_VARS="NODE_ENV=production,VITE_MCP_SERVER_URL=/api/mcp,VITE_APP_NAME=AI Universe,VITE_DEBUG_MODE=false"
            TRAFFIC_FLAG=""
            ;;
    esac

    echo_success "Deployment to GCP completed"
    # Step 1: Build the container image
    IMAGE_TAG="gcr.io/$PROJECT_ID/$SERVICE_NAME:$ENVIRONMENT-$(date +%s)"
    echo_info "Building container image: $IMAGE_TAG"
    gcloud builds submit . --tag "$IMAGE_TAG"

    # Step 2: Deploy the pre-built image
    echo_info "Deploying to $ENVIRONMENT environment..."
    gcloud run deploy "$SERVICE_NAME" \
        --image "$IMAGE_TAG" \
        --platform managed \
        --region us-central1 \
        --allow-unauthenticated \
        --set-env-vars="$ENV_VARS" \
        --memory=512Mi \
        --timeout=300 \
        --min-instances=0 \
        --max-instances=5 \
        --concurrency=80 \
        $TRAFFIC_FLAG

    echo_success "Deployment to Cloud Run completed"
}

# Function to upload static assets to Cloud Storage

// Debug logging middleware (before JSON parsing)
app.use((req, res, next) => {
  console.log(`${req.method} ${req.url}`);
  next();
});

// Health check endpoint
app.get('/health', (req, res) => {
  res.json({ status: 'healthy', service: 'ai-universe-proxy', timestamp: new Date().toISOString() });
});

// Proxy all /mcp requests to the backend (MUST come before static files)
app.use('/mcp', createProxyMiddleware({
// Use EXACT same proxy pattern as local development
app.use('/api', createProxyMiddleware({
  target: 'https://ai-universe-backend-114133832173.us-central1.run.app',
  changeOrigin: true,
  pathRewrite: {
    '^/mcp': '/mcp'
  },
  onProxyReq: (proxyReq, req, res) => {
    console.log('Proxying request:', req.method, req.url);
    console.log(`✅ PROXY: ${req.method} ${req.url} → ${proxyReq.path}`);
  },
  onProxyRes: (proxyRes, req, res) => {
    console.log('Received response:', proxyRes.statusCode, req.url);
    // Add CORS headers to the response
    proxyRes.headers['Access-Control-Allow-Origin'] = '*';
    proxyRes.headers['Access-Control-Allow-Methods'] = 'GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, OPTIONS';
    proxyRes.headers['Access-Control-Allow-Headers'] = 'Content-Type, Authorization, Accept, Mcp-Session-Id';
    console.log(`✅ RESPONSE: ${proxyRes.statusCode} from ${req.url}`);
  },
  onError: (err, req, res) => {
    console.error('Proxy error:', err);
    // Use Express response methods instead of Node.js raw response
    res.status(502).json({
      error: 'Proxy error',
      message: err.message
    });
    console.error(`❌ PROXY ERROR: ${err.message}`);
    if (!res.headersSent) {
      res.status(502).json({ error: 'MCP Proxy Error', message: err.message });
    }
@cursor cursor bot 15 minutes ago
Bug: API Proxy Missing Path Rewriting
The /api proxy is missing path rewriting to strip the /api prefix. This sends requests like /api/mcp to the backend as /api/mcp, while the backend expects /mcp, causing routing failures. This behavior differs from the development proxy.

Fix in Cursor Fix in Web

@@ -8,19 +8,26 @@ WORKDIR /app
COPY package*.json ./

# Install all dependencies (needed for build)
RUN npm install
RUN npm ci

# Copy source code
COPY . .

# Build the application
RUN npm run build

# Remove dev dependencies
RUN npm prune --production
# Install only production dependencies and remove dev dependencies
RUN npm ci --only=production && npm cache clean --force

# Create a non-root user
RUN addgroup -g 1001 -S nodejs && adduser -S nodeuser -u 1001

# Change ownership of the app directory to the nodeuser
RUN chown -R nodeuser:nodejs /app
USER nodeuser

# Expose port
EXPOSE 8080

# Start the server
CMD ["node", "server.js"]
CMD ["node", "proxy-server.cjs"]

@@ -129,29 +129,57 @@ build_app() {
    echo_success "Build completed successfully"
}

# Function to deploy to GCP
# Function to deploy to GCP Cloud Run
deploy_to_gcp() {
    echo_info "Deploying to Google Cloud Platform..."
    echo_info "Deploying to Google Cloud Run..."

    # Set the correct GCP project
    gcloud config set project $PROJECT_ID

    # Enable required APIs
    echo_info "Enabling Cloud Run API..."
    gcloud services enable run.googleapis.com

    # Build container image first (faster and more reliable)
    case $ENVIRONMENT in
        dev)
            echo_info "Deploying to development environment..."
            gcloud app deploy --version=dev --no-promote --quiet
            SERVICE_NAME="ai-universe-frontend-dev"
            ENV_VARS="NODE_ENV=development,VITE_MCP_SERVER_URL=/api/mcp,VITE_APP_NAME=AI Universe Dev,VITE_DEBUG_MODE=true"
            TRAFFIC_FLAG="--no-traffic"
            ;;
        staging)
            echo_info "Deploying to staging environment..."
            gcloud app deploy --version=staging --no-promote --quiet
            SERVICE_NAME="ai-universe-frontend-staging"
            ENV_VARS="NODE_ENV=staging,VITE_MCP_SERVER_URL=/api/mcp,VITE_APP_NAME=AI Universe Staging,VITE_DEBUG_MODE=false"
            TRAFFIC_FLAG="--no-traffic"
            ;;
        prod)
            echo_info "Deploying to production environment..."
            gcloud app deploy --quiet
            SERVICE_NAME="ai-universe-frontend"
            ENV_VARS="NODE_ENV=production,VITE_MCP_SERVER_URL=/api/mcp,VITE_APP_NAME=AI Universe,VITE_DEBUG_MODE=false"
            TRAFFIC_FLAG=""
            ;;
    esac

    echo_success "Deployment to GCP completed"
    # Step 1: Build the container image
    IMAGE_TAG="gcr.io/$PROJECT_ID/$SERVICE_NAME:$ENVIRONMENT-$(date +%s)"
    echo_info "Building container image: $IMAGE_TAG"
    gcloud builds submit . --tag "$IMAGE_TAG"

    # Step 2: Deploy the pre-built image
    echo_info "Deploying to $ENVIRONMENT environment..."
    gcloud run deploy "$SERVICE_NAME" \
        --image "$IMAGE_TAG" \
        --platform managed \
        --region us-central1 \
        --allow-unauthenticated \
        --set-env-vars="$ENV_VARS" \
        --memory=512Mi \
        --timeout=300 \
        --min-instances=0 \
        --max-instances=5 \
        --concurrency=80 \
        $TRAFFIC_FLAG

    echo_success "Deployment to Cloud Run completed"
}

# Function to upload static assets to Cloud Storage

4. Monitor network requests to see what's happening with the /api/mcp calls

ITERATION: 1
PREVIOUS WORK: 

EXECUTION PLANNING INSTRUCTIONS:
1. First, read available slash commands to understand what tools are available:
   - Use: `ls .claude/commands/` to see all available slash command files
   - Use: `/commands` to get a categorized overview of available commands
   - Consider commands like: /converge, /execute, /test, /debug, /fake3, etc.
2. Break down this overall goal into logical substeps for this iteration
3. Create an execution plan that uses /converge as the primary workflow command
4. Encourage debugging, testing, validation, and iterative refinement - not just coding
5. Consider what slash commands would be most effective for this specific task

Generate a comprehensive execution prompt that includes:
- Substep breakdown for this iteration
- Recommended slash commands to use
- Testing and debugging strategy
- Validation approach

Format your response as an execution prompt that another Claude instance will execute.
